creator: sriluu@hotmail.com
text:
I am working on tomcat 4.1.24. I'm not able to detect IP address of people 
connecting to my web site since I always get 127.0.0.1 as RemoteAddress.

Any help will be highly appreciated.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
That works fine for me. You'll probably want to investigate on tomcat-user first
before filing a bug. If you are certain there's a bug, please indicate how to
reproduce it (using the default config won't do ...).

creator: sriluu@hotmail.com
text:
I am calling  "getRemoteAddr()" method on “HttpServletRequest” object in my 
servlet to get IP address of client. That is always returning 127.0.0.1 instead 
of correct IP address. I am testing this with out any proxy server.

If it is working for you can you please tell me, how you are getting the 
correct IP address.

Thank you very much.

I have tested calling the same "getRemoteAddr()" method of "HttpServletRequest" 
object under Weblogic server. That is showing correct IP address.
creator: sriluu@hotmail.com

text:
Please debug using the tomcat-user list. From this report we do not know the
type of connector you are using or any other meaningful information to recreate
the bug. The users on tomcat-user will point out if there really is a bug.
